definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Japanese Army 16th Division Infantry troops climb up the walls near Zhongshan Gate.
sentences.chinese: 日軍第十六師團步兵攀上中山門。

sentences.english: ErNian dont want to die, grandma to her out of the gate.
sentences.chinese: 二孃不願死，奶奶將她攆出山門。

sentences.english: Temple sitting West headed east, on both sides of the gate-two stone lions and two Shek Kwu.
sentences.chinese: 寺坐西朝東，山門兩側各放兩隻石獅子和兩隻石鼓。

sentences.english: We entered the gate with me.
Engineer Corps of Japanese Army 16th Division removes blockage of sandbags at Zhongshan Gate.
sentences.chinese: 日軍第十六師團的工兵在搬開封閉中山門的土袋。

sentences.english: The south side is the main hall, the main building for days after the palace.
sentences.chinese: 山門南面是大殿，爲天后行宮的主體建築。

sentences.english: The Shanmen silver deposit is a large, independent one.
sentences.chinese: 山門銀礦爲大型獨立銀礦牀。

sentences.english: In the gate house, there are also four celestial kings(four heavenly kings of Buddhism).
sentences.chinese: 在山門殿，同時也有四大天王。

definition: Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
Mt Tai 泰山 in Shandong, one of the Five Sacred Mountains 五嶽|五岳[Wu3 yue4]
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
Taoist or Buddhist rite/abbr. for 菩提道場|菩提道场[Pu2 ti2 dao4 chang3]
